result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael James Parent

records.addlTxt: Order for Competency Evaluation by Department of Health Services
Order for Competency Evaluation by Department of Health Services

10:28 AM Defendant Michael James Parent in court, in custody.  Attorney Lucas A Wyshnytzky in court for Michael James Parent.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties note that letter from ALJ was filed to Judge Thimm. Attorney Wyshnytzky will be asking for a competency evaluation. State takes no position. Court order competency evaluation. Court reviews time limits for competency evaluation. Hearing to be set. Clerk to send order, will receive report within 30 days.
Competency hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Packet from State of WI division of hearings and appeals re: competency issue raised in other WI files
Letter from Judge Thimm to Cara Larson

9:30 AM Defendant Michael James Parent in court, in custody.  Attorney Lucas A Wyshnytzky in court for Michael James Parent.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Wyshynytzky received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty plea. Attorney Wyshyntytzky asks for status conference. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Letter to Judge Glonek from Defendant
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

3:29 PM Prosecuting attorney Chad C La Lor in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael James Parent appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Michael Hoffman for defendant. Court verifies defendant's address. Attorney Hoffman received complaint, waives reading and requests preliminary hearing. State requests $5,000 cash bail and conditions of no contact with Ravin Crossbows. State notes defendant has pending warrant out of St. Croix County he has not made an appearance on. Defendant will likely face revocation on case sentenced in July 2021. 2003 - Eau Claire County, WI on extended supervision. Defendant has lengthy record of felony convictions in several WI counties and does not feel local ties are strong. Attorney Hoffman states defendant has lived locally for several years and defendant cannot post any cash bail. He currently is on hold. Court orders $1,500 cash bail with condition of no contact with Ravin Crossbows.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
